overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to a short time-series forecasting problem with limited data. The analyst systematically evaluates multiple methods, ultimately selecting a simple averaging technique due to data constraints and unclear trends. Key steps include data inspection, pattern identification, method comparison, and detailed manual calculations with careful rounding.
key_insights: Prioritization of simplicity over complex models (SARIMA/ETS) for small datasets
Hourly averaging to capture daily seasonality when trends are inconsistent
Manual data inspection to compute daily patterns and assess trend viability
Precision in rounding outputs to match input data format specifications
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with thorough method evaluation and detailed manual computations, though ultimately implemented through a simple heuristic approach due to data limitations.
